reviews.review_msg: No Comments

Blair is a good professor. My biggest problem with him is that he talks way too fast, and he chooses rather boring films. I fell asleep in all the lectures because the films never really held my attention, with the exception of "Ali: Fear Eats the Soul," I liked that a lot. Also, the textbook he uses is very very boring and irrelevant.

Not only the coolest dude in the school, but one helluva nice guy, looks like Edward Norton in Fight Club. If you can handle writing essays that say alot about nothing, then this course is gravy. Watch the movies, have opinions...that's it!
Awesome course, informable content. Good use of film choice.  A fair marker.

Great prof, always willing to help. All the negative ratings below seem like the same person with some grudge, and thats just SAD. I came into this course expecting not to like it (because I needed a fine arts course for my program), but Blair did such a great job that I ended up loving the class, as did everyone else I talked to.
Pretty good, needs to learn to slow down and make sure everyone's on the same page, but he's understanding when you come and ask for help.

He was a fabulous prof.  Always very helpful and was very clear that he was knowledged in what he was teaching.  He was passionate about his class and tried his best to help the class understand the material.  Most films were very interesting. I thought it was a class worth taking as an elective.  M

Pretty cool prof! Very approachable, funny, and easy going. It is nice to go to a class where the teacher is interested in and passionate about what hes teaching. I really enjoyed his class. Pretty cute too!

This is one great professor! Very approachable, friendly, knowledgeabe and easy to listen to. He really seems to love what he's doing-but be careful of his writing-it's kind of hard to decipher. He's definately the best professor I've ever had. He's funny and smart...plus, he's not hard on the eyes!
Super helpful guy. Always in a good mood. Anyone who thinks Team America was hilarious is a-ok.

Really nice guy, and very approachable. Lectures may seem long at times but he'll crack the odd joke or do an impression to lighten the mood. Keep in mind time period of movies you're watching b4 signing up.My advice is not to leave the big essay until the last minute...o crap i'd better go do mine
Nice guy, good sense of humour. Anyone who talks about the Simpsons in class is okay by me.  I enjoyed this class more than I thought I would.
No Comments

Chris is great, keeps things interesting and insightful. Strikes a good balance in teaching established film theories while also critically questioning their applicability and relevance. Exams are extremely fair. Great personality.

Chris is such a great prof! Real funny, keeps lectures very interesting! He makes 3 hour lectures a breeze! Lectures are a must attend because you NEED to see all the films/clips. Most of them are really old, so they're hard to find online. Memorize bold terms in Film Art. Oxford History not so important. PAY ATTENTION/STUDY THE WEBCT READINGS WELL

Really fun class. Chris loves what he does and he's a really loveable prof. Not a hard class but must attend lectures or at least watch all the movies that are shown in the lectures. Exams are mostly based on those movies and the text. Tutorials are really helpful, attend them!

Really amazing class. Prof is hilarious/nice/and articulates all arguments perfectly.  Make sure you do the online readings and just know the bold words in the Film Art textbook. Didn't even open Oxford History.  TA's really know their stuff.  I took it as a Breadth requirement for my Bio degree and thoroughly enjoyed it.

He's a funny, articulate, and clear guy. Unforunately, the amount of reading assigned is impossible. Warning: the reading is due for the day of the lecture, and there is some for the first one. So, you will have 2 weeks of reading in the first week of class. I never recovered from this, even though I have an A/A-. Read the essays, forget the books.

WAY too much reading for a film course!!!! Or any course- it really is that bad. Chris is humourous, the course material is rich and very useful, except that the amount of reading required is ABSURD, and the tutorial a waste of time, even though the my TA is such a super-nice person.

His comments are often political and always humourous. I would sit in on another of his classes just because he's such a great speaker. I took this as an elective and have enjoyed the lectures; there is a lot of reading but you can do well by skimmming Film Art and WebCT readings and listening to summaries in tutorial. TA was disorganized.

Chris is really funny in an off beat sort of way.  I love the stuff he teaches because it is often very philosophical.  If you are looking for a history course I don't recommend FPA 136 or 137, but if you want to debate the theories of great french film critics this is the course for you!  Advice: focus on the articles NOT Oxford history.

Awesome prof, awesome class.  I thought it would be a slack class where I just got to watch movies for an easy A.  It was actually kind of challenging because there was a lot of reading.  He kept the lectures funny and entertaining and the movies got better and better.  Favourite class!

great prof,great class..he is funny and totally charming.The only thing i'd say is there's waaay too much reading and he talks really fast and sometimes it's hard to take notes.But the prof is wonderful and everytime i go to class i'm happy
